answers.answer: Sometimes mine are very dark too. I think it depends on what you have eaten within the past few days. I ate some red velvet cake a while back and my stool the next day was a dark red color, so I was assuming this was from the cake I ate. Just make sure the color doesn't stay the dark color you are describing for over 2 weeks, if it does then you need to bring this to a doctors attention.

question: i am 29 years old female with diabetes type 1... my diabetes is in control...i have always (through out my life) very very dark brown hard stool with no complications...some times constipation...i have my some blood tests 15 days before creatinine, cholestrol, HDL and LDL they are normal....some times i have gas problem..my diet is normal... please tell me is this serious...please tell me
title: dark brown stool
